summary: Official notification from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center to federal judges regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019. The letter states Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell from an apparent suicide, was transported to a hospital where he was pronounced dead, and that the FBI and DOJ Inspector General are investigating the incident.

persons.context: The subject of the letter, reported to have died by apparent suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: Martin Weinberg is listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in the official notification of his death.
Reid Weingarten is listed as counsel for Jeffrey Epstein in the official notification of his death.
As Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center, N'Diaye was responsible for the facility where Epstein was held and died.
Judge McMahon was presiding over the case against Jeffrey Epstein and was officially notified of his death.
Judge Berman was presiding over the case against Jeffrey Epstein and was officially notified of his death.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead at 7:37 a.m.

events.title: Official Notification to Court
events.description: Warden Amine N'Diaye sent formal written notification to Chief Judge Colleen McMahon and Judge Richard M. Berman regarding Epstein's death.

events.title: Initiation of Investigations
events.description: The FBI began actively investigating Epstein's death, and the Attorney General requested the DOJ Office of the Inspector General to also investigate the matter.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital, New York, New York
Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse, 500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007-1312
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at approximately 7:37 a.m. at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital.
Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center around 6:30 a.m. from an apparent suicide.
The FBI is actively investigating the incident, and the Attorney General has requested the DOJ Office of the Inspector General to also investigate.
An autopsy was pending at the time of the notification to determine the official cause of death.
The official notification was sent to the presiding judges in Epstein's case (McMahon and Berman) and copied to multiple law enforcement officials and Epstein's defense attorneys.
